title: Greatest Jerseys of All Time
content:
Lots of magnificent shots of hockey sweaters with awesome vintage graphics.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130324051910im_/http:/typophile.com/files/THNS09JERSEY_6231.jpg)
  
My favourite: Trail Smoke Eaters 1938-39.  
Close second: Seattle Metropolitans, 1923-24 (shown on cover).
author: Nick Shinn

There is indeed no unanimity in Canadian English about hockey jersey (cf. “third jersey”) vs. hockey sweater (cf. classic animated short film <cite>The Sweater</cite>). I think material of construction is important. Classic Canadiens jerseys are really sweaters. 1990s Phoenix Coyotes sweaters, which were an absolutely amazing example of 3D graphic design, were really jerseys.
